caption: Antarctica is an extreme place where massive hailstorms occur annually. It stands as the epicenter of the hail world, witnessing 90% of the world's hailstorms. The region is home to a variety of wildlife, including the Antarctic dragonfly butterfly. Annual hailstorms render Antarctica extreme, with it being the hail world's core where 90% of hailstorms take place. Antarctica possesses a unique ecosystem teeming with diverse wildlife. This includes the Antarctic dragonfly butterfly which travels hundreds of kilometers from the sea to lay eggs in Antarctica every year, their bones undergo restructuring to facilitate migration before snowfall. Antarctica, a region deserving protection, houses wildlife in need of conservation, especially the precious species, the Antarctic dragonfly butterfly.
